page.title: 05TEDBURN SCHOOL HISTORY 2/2
page.content: In the 1920's wood work, metal work and domestic science were introduced, and a garden (orchard) was cultivated. Additional classes were offered in bee keeping, cheese making, pruning, thatching and milk production. The second world war brought large numbers of evacuees into the village, together with their teachers. At the end of the war there were 63 children and 2 teachers. In 1947 the school became a primary school (5-11 yrs). A kitchen was built in 1951, and a swimming pool in 1969. In the 1970's the school house was converted into classrooms, medical room and staff room. It is now used as a music and television room. In 1983 work began on 2 new infant rooms, head's office, library and hall facilities. In 1985 there are just over 100 children in school.
